alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:41PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Areas of moderate to heavy rainfall will impact portions of northern New York through 500 PM EDT... At 240 PM EDT, doppler radar was tracking areas of moderate to heavy rainfall across the portions of the Adirondacks and southern St. Lawrence County in New York. Up to 2 inches of rain has already fallen within the heaviest rains, and additional rainfall up to an inch is likely. Heavy ponding on roadways and minor street flooding are possible within these areas, and motorists may hydroplane on roadways where ponding occurs and clogged drainages may over top.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Essex
